Thanks a ton
When we go for text based output we even get all the 
system.out.println statement outputs in the console. 
Is removing these statements the only way out ?

Also this is a servlet java file which we tested on the server with 
lots of dependencies. Can we test the same on Windows Client through 
Sockets or some mode without copying over the dependencies ?

Thanks in advance
Anand

--- In junit@y..., Robert Watkins <robertw@q...> wrote:
> > Could you elaborate on that ? 
> > I tried on my client machine and it works and I use Windows 2000 
if 
> > that is of any significance
> 
> Sure.
> 
> You are trying to use a Swing-based program on a Unix/Linux server. 
In order
> to do this, you need to have an available x11 console (the graphical
> interface under Unix). You do not get this sort of interface over, 
say, a
> telnet session.
> 
> Without that, you get the sort of exception you are seeing. Stick 
to using
> the textui runner on your server.
> 
> Robert.
> 
> -- 
>      "Duct tape is like the Force: it has a light side, a dark side,
>                    and it holds the universe together"
>   Robert Watkins     robertdw@b...     robertw@q...
subject: Re: Error while using junit.swingui.TestRunner - ( Se rver - WebLogic )
